text: Acalypha dictyoneura is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador, where it grows in the cloud forests of the Andes. There are six known populations.Santiana, J., et al. 2004. Acalypha dictyoneura. In: IUCN 2013. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2013.1. Downloaded on 12 September 2013. ==References== dictyoneura Category:Endemic flora of Ecuador Category:Near threatened plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
